Manual » 3. HTML

3.1. Form Objects

Contents

  1. Example
  2. Attributes

Example

Any attribute can have its value from a database query by setting the value like; 

 echo CMForm::TextBox(array(
   'name' => 'textfield',
   'value' => $dbh->query('select firstname from people')
 ));

For textboxes this will use the the value of the first column of the first row. For menus/lists it will use the first column for values and the second column for text

Attributes

Name Default Description
caption false If this is set to 1, any form object will only be printed as non-editable text.
captionempty "" If the caption attribute is set but blank, this caption is used instead.
checked value attribute This only applies to a Checkbox.
class false CSS class for entire object.
custom false Any extra attribute to be entered into the object. This applies to all objects.
data false Data source. Data can be a string for text boxes, but must be a key/value array for menus/lists.
disabled false Field is diabled. false is off, any other value is true.
height false This onld applies to ListBox. The number of items in the list selection.
html false If this is true values will be used as is and not parsed through htmlspecialchars().
id name attribute ID (for CSS) of the HTML object, if this is not set it will use the value of the name attribute.
label false Label.
name "" Name of the HTML form object.
onblur false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onchange false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onclick false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
ondblclick false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onfocus false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onkeydown false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onkeypress false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onkeyup false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onmousedown false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onmouseout false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onmousemove false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onmouseup false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onmouseover false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
onselect false JavaScript action can be added to all HTML form objects.
readonly false Field is read only. false is off, any other value is true.
style false CSS style attribute for entire object.
tabindex false Tab index tells the browser the order in which the fields are to be tabbed through.
value "" For menus this will be the value of the selected item, and for textboxes this will be the internal text. If the object is a CheckboxGroup: The value can be a single value for only 1 checkbox selected, or an array to select multiple checkboxes. The rules for each indervidual checked box is the same as for Checkbox.
width false The number of characters wide the field is.
wrap "off" Only applies to TextArea.
Generated by  1.6.3
